decks.notes: The deck focuses on using artifacts and sacrificing them for various effects, while also having aggressive creatures to pressure the opponent. It includes cards like Urza's Saga to generate value from creating artifact tokens, as well as cards like Springleaf Drum and Mox Opal to ramp out threats quickly. The deck also utilizes Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategies. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of artifact synergies and aggressive creatures.

This aggro deck focuses on using a combination of powerful creatures like Scion of Draco and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also utilizes Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own creatures. With a mix of aggressive creatures and control elements, this deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain board control throughout the game to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending. It also utilizes instant speed removal like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to control the board. Atraxa, Grand Unifier helps to combo off with other creatures and spells, while Thoughtseize and Force of Negation provide disruption against opponents. The deck also includes card draw and filtering with Ephemerate and Meticulous Archive, as well as protection with Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on quickly casting cheap artifacts, utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp into powerful threats like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Pinnacle Emissary. With the help of Urza's Saga and Cranial Plating, the deck aims to create a wide board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. Thoughtcast and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage, while Aether Spellbomb and Engineered Explosives provide removal options. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around utilizing artifact synergies to create a fast and powerful offense.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact while dealing direct damage with Lightning Bolt and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Territorial Kavu and Scion of Draco to provide strong creatures that can close out the game quickly. By combining aggressive creatures with efficient removal and control elements, this deck seeks to maintain pressure and dictate the pace of the game.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature strategies while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory. It utilizes powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Solitude to apply pressure and control the board. The deck also takes advantage of the companion Obosh, the Preypiercer to increase its damage output. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells, while also maintaining a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of instant and sorcery spells to control the board, counter opponent's spells, and eventually win with the combo of Goblin Charbelcher. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's plans while setting up your own win condition through counterspells, card draw, and tutoring for key combo pieces. By efficiently managing resources and timing plays, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory without relying on traditional land-based strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to mill the opponent's deck as quickly and efficiently as possible using cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, Fractured Sanity, and Mind Funeral. The deck also includes counter spells like Drown in the Loch to protect against opponent's threats. Archive Trap and Surgical Extraction are used to disrupt the opponent's library while Tasha's Hideous Laughter serves as a finisher. The deck is designed to control the game by removing key cards from the opponent's library and hand, ultimately leading to a win through deck depletion.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to control the board and slow down the opponent's tempo while setting up for powerful late-game threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck also includes a mix of efficient creatures and planeswalkers to provide additional threats and value. By efficiently answering threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to take control of the game and secure victory through attrition and inevitability.

This Ruby Storm combo deck is focused on generating a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, aided by ramp cards like Ruby Medallion. The deck then aims to cast multiple spells in a turn to trigger powerful effects like Grapeshot and Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability to finish off the opponent in one explosive turn. The deck also includes cards like Wrenn's Resolve and Valakut Awakening to help with card draw and consistency. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure reliable mana fixing.

The main concept of this Modern Ruby Storm deck is to quickly generate mana and cast a high number of spells in a single turn to generate a massive storm count. By combining Ritual effects like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual with mana generators like Ruby Medallion and Manamorphose, the deck aims to chain together spells and then finish off the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot or Strike It Rich. The deck also includes Ral, Monsoon Mage as a strong win condition and provides card advantage with Past in Flames and Valakut Awakening.

The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Monastery Swiftspear, and Slickshot Show-Off, combined with burn spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt, to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Expressive Iteration and Preordain to dig for more threats and answers. Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge provide combat tricks and additional damage, while Mishra's Bauble helps with card selection. The mana base includes fetch lands like Scalding Tarn and Wooded Foothills to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively pressure the opponent with quick and efficient creatures while maintaining card advantage and minimizing mana expenditure. The deck combines powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart with efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply constant pressure. The inclusion of cards like Mutagenic Growth and Slickshot Show-Off allows for additional damage output and card selection, while Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help to ensure consistent draws and maintain tempo. The deck focuses on speed, efficiency, and adaptability to overwhelm opponents.

This deck focuses on using a variety of creatures to create powerful combos and synergies. It utilizes creatures like Cauldron Familiar, Carrion Feeder, and Young Wolf to generate value and control the board. Cards like Chord of Calling and Sylvan Safekeeper help to search for key combo pieces. Grist, the Hunger Tide and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician provide additional ways to leverage the creatures in the deck for maximum impact. The toolbox approach allows for flexibility and adaptability in different matchups, making it a versatile and strategic deck to pilot.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. The deck also utilizes cards like Goblin Bombardment for additional direct damage and potential removal. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and other planeswalkers adds versatility and power to the deck, while cards like Elegant Parlor and Static Prison provide control and disruption to the opponent's game plan. The main strategy is to establish board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures and spells to control the board while applying pressure to the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation, while also presenting threats like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk. The deck also includes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and powerful creature removal options like Solitude and Subtlety. With a mix of disruptive elements and aggressive creatures, this deck looks to outmaneuver and overwhelm the opponent in a fast-paced game.
